assumption.Assumptions: Security and availability of the cloud (including the database, the service, the infrastructure, the platform, etc.) is the responsibility of the cloud service provider (CSP) / data center
assumption.Comments: As per Bosch guidelines, the cloud on-boarding team (BSI) is responsible for ensuring this and it must be informed of any security needs concerned with configuration of Cloud Infrastructure

assumption.Assumptions: Third party software / libraries are trusted and are compatible, that is, when integrated with the TOE do not endanger it.

assumption.Assumptions: Diagnosis will be performed only through trusted hardware an trustworthy personal

assumption.Assumptions: Physical security and safety of the devices is the responsibility of the customer
assumption.Comments: Physical security and safety of the device must be ensured by customer. Physical access of devices must be monitored and controlled by customer.
assumption.assumption: Physical security and safety of the devices is the responsibility of the customer
assumption.assumption_comment: Physical security and safety of the device must be ensured by customer. Physical access of devices must be monitored and controlled by customer.

assumption.Assumptions: Connected devices follow robust security measures
assumption.Comments: Updated antivirus software, firewalls, and other security features on devices shall be done by the users.
assumption.assumption: Connected devices follow robust security measures
assumption.assumption_comment: Updated antivirus software, firewalls, and other security features on devices shall be done by the users.

assumption.Assumptions: Physical access to networking equipment is restricted
assumption.assumption: Physical access to networking equipment is restricted

assumption.Assumptions: Connectivity between Gateway and Internet is always available
assumption.assumption: Connectivity between Gateway and Internet is always available

assumption.Assumptions: Physical Security of the Gateway, NILM, MMUE and Access Point is the responsibility of the Customer
assumption.assumption: Physical Security of the Gateway, NILM, MMUE and Access Point is the responsibility of the Customer

assumption.Assumptions: Routers and connected devices are regularly updated with the latest firmware and software patches
assumption.Comments: Outdated firmware can expose vulnerabilities that attackers may exploit
assumption.assumption: Routers and connected devices are regularly updated with the latest firmware and software patches
assumption.assumption_comment: Outdated firmware can expose vulnerabilities that attackers may exploit

assumption.Assumptions: All the debug interfaces like JTAG shall be disabled in hardware in production.
assumption.assumption: All the debug interfaces like JTAG shall be disabled in hardware in production.

assumption.Assumptions: Tamper protection shall be implemented to prevent reading memory by direct physical access.
assumption.Comments: Board level mitigations should be done
assumption.assumption: Tamper protection shall be implemented to prevent reading memory by direct physical access.
assumption.assumption_comment: Board level mitigations should be done

assumption.Assumptions: Access to all unused physical interfaces in micro-controller are blocked.
assumption.assumption: Access to all unused physical interfaces in micro-controller are blocked.

assumption.Assumptions: Attacker does not have physical access to the device
assumption.assumption: Attacker does not have physical access to the device

assumption.Assumptions: Sensor data is assumed to be correct unless manipulated by an attacker
assumption.assumption: Sensor data is assumed to be correct unless manipulated by an attacker

assumption.Assumptions: The bus connection to the ECU offers both diagnostic capabilities (the OEM) as well as communication with other ECUs.
assumption.assumption: The bus connection to the ECU offers both diagnostic capabilities (the OEM) as well as communication with other ECUs.

assumption.Assumptions: Sensor data is assumed to be correct unless manipulated by an attacker
assumption.assumption: Sensor data is assumed to be correct unless manipulated by an attacker

assumption.Assumptions: Physical access to devices with serial ports is adequately controlled.
assumption.Comments: Unrestricted physical access could result in unauthorized data interception, injection, or manipulation through the serial port.
assumption.assumption: Physical access to devices with serial ports is adequately controlled.
assumption.assumption_comment: Unrestricted physical access could result in unauthorized data interception, injection, or manipulation through the serial port.

assumption.Assumptions: Data transmitted over serial ports is encrypted
assumption.assumption: Data transmitted over serial ports is encrypted

assumption.Assumptions: Configuration of serial ports, such as baud rate, parity, and stop bits, is properly set to prevent potential security vulnerabilities.
assumption.Comments: Incorrect configurations may lead to communication errors or be exploited by attackers to manipulate data transmission.
assumption.assumption: Configuration of serial ports, such as baud rate, parity, and stop bits, is properly set to prevent potential security vulnerabilities.
assumption.assumption_comment: Incorrect configurations may lead to communication errors or be exploited by attackers to manipulate data transmission.

assumption.Assumptions: Monitoring and logging mechanisms are in place to track activities related to serial ports, allowing for the detection of suspicious or unauthorized activities.
assumption.Comments: Without monitoring malicious activities may go undetected.
assumption.assumption: Monitoring and logging mechanisms are in place to track activities related to serial ports, allowing for the detection of suspicious or unauthorized activities.
assumption.assumption_comment: Without monitoring malicious activities may go undetected.

misuse.MUC Description: Attacker stealing sensitive information, such as vehicle identification numbers, encryption keys, or control signals.

misuse.muc_description: Attacker stealing sensitive information, such as vehicle identification numbers, encryption keys, or control signals.
misuse.muc_comment:
The attacker can read all messages sent over the FlexRay 
network. This is a serious vulnerability that could allow the attacker to steal sensitive information, such as financial data or personal identification numbers.

misuse.MUC Description: Attacker could send a message that commands a vehicle to brake or accelerate unexpectedly.
misuse.Comment:
This is a serious security risk, as it could be used to cause a 
vehicle to crash. The attacker could send this message by hacking into the FlexRay network, which is a high-speed communication network used in many modern vehicles.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Disclosure of Personally Identifiable Information
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: Unauthorized reading of database or sniffing of communication may lead to disclosure and abuse of personally identifiable information
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: Compliance to international and national legal privacy requirements and standards such as GDPR is mandatory and this may lead to penalties.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Disclosure of Personally Identifiable Information
damageScenario.consequence_DS: Unauthorized reading of database or sniffing of communication may lead to disclosure and abuse of personally identifiable information
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Compliance to international and national legal privacy requirements and standards such as GDPR is mandatory and this may lead to penalties.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Degradation or disruption or loss of functionality or unreliable operation
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: Services are affected but can be restored within a toleratable period of time
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Degradation or disruption or loss of functionality or unreliable operation
damageScenario.consequence_DS: There is a chance of functional or operational degradation due to manipulation of data or application itself.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Services are affected but can be restored within a toleratable period of time

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Loss of customer trust
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Loss of customer trust
damageScenario.consequence_DS: Customer trust/confidence is important for future business. For example loss of private information of customer
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: Trust of specific people, partners are violated, which in turn affect the future business with them and impacts the growth of the company.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Disclosure of IP or Proprietary Data or sensitive Information, Unauthorized copying or cloning, Unauthorized use
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: Unauthorized reading of firmware or update may lead to IP disclosure
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque:
Research effort expended in developing Bosch IP is lost.
Engineering effort will be lost.
IP differentiates Bosch from competition and provides competitive edge. Thus loss of IP diminishes the competitive edge.
Potential financial cost of damage too decides the consequence rating.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Misuse or manipulation affecting Bosch
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: Services are affected but can be restored within a toleratable period of time
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque:
Research effort expended in developing Bosch IP is lost.
Engineering effort will be lost.
IP differentiates Bosch from competition and provides competitive edge. Thus loss of IP diminishes the competitive edge.
Potential financial cost of damage too decides the consequence rating.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Misuse or manipulation affecting Bosch
damageScenario.consequence_DS: Services are affected but can be restored within a toleratable period of time
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning:
Research effort expended in developing Bosch IP is lost.
Engineering effort will be lost.
IP differentiates Bosch from competition and provides competitive edge. Thus loss of IP diminishes the competitive edge.
Potential financial cost of damage too decides the consequence rating.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Crash of Vehicle
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: An unreliable in-vehicle communication could affect the signals from the brake system ECU to the related actuators. This would mean a limitation of the braking functionality and could lead to a crash.
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque:
In a crash human safety could be severely affected leading to loss/losses of life.
Damage to the car / passenger or third parties
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Crash of Vehicle
damageScenario.consequence_DS: An unreliable in-vehicle communication could affect the signals from the brake system ECU to the related actuators. This would mean a limitation of the braking functionality and could lead to a crash.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning:
In a crash human safety could be severely affected leading to loss/losses of life.
Damage to the car / passenger or third parties

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Laws, regulations and contracts are violated leading to penalties
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo:
Stealing sensitive information, such as
 financial data or personal identification numbers.
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: This is a serious vulnerability that could allow the attacker to steal sensitive information, such as financial data or personal identification numbers.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Laws, regulations and contracts are violated leading to penalties
damageScenario.consequence_DS:
Stealing sensitive information, such as
 financial data or personal identification numbers.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: This is a serious vulnerability that could allow the attacker to steal sensitive information, such as financial data or personal identification numbers.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Human safety could be severely affected leading to loss/losses of life
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo:
The attacker could send this message by 
hacking into the FlexRay network, which is a high-speed communication network used in many modern vehicles.
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: This is a serious security risk, as it could be used to cause a vehicle to crash.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Human safety could be severely affected leading to loss/losses of life
damageScenario.consequence_DS:
The attacker could send this message by 
hacking into the FlexRay network, which is a high-speed communication network used in many modern vehicles.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: This is a serious security risk, as it could be used to cause a vehicle to crash.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Customers or business partners are irritated and inconvenienced
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo:
Attacker can overwhelm the network 
and prevent legitimate messages from being sent
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: This is  a moderate risk as it is effect the services which must be available to legitimate users

damageScenario.consequence_DS:

and prevent legitimate messages from being sent
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: This is  a moderate risk as it is effect the services which must be available to legitimate users

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Stealing data, disrupt operations
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: Stealing sensitive information, such as financial data or personal identification numbers.
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque:
This is a moderate-impact threat, as it 
does not typically cause any immediate damage. However, it can be used to steal sensitive data, which could then be used to commit identity theft, financial fraud, or other crimes.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Stealing data, disrupt operations
damageScenario.consequence_DS: Stealing sensitive information, such as financial data or personal identification numbers.
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning:
This is a moderate-impact threat, as it 
does not typically cause any immediate damage. However, it can be used to steal sensitive data, which could then be used to commit identity theft, financial fraud, or other crimes.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Stealing and manuplating sensitive data
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: If senstive data is stolen then it will cause huge loss to indivial as well as organization
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: This could have a devastating impact on the organization, depending on the data that is stolen or the systems that are taken offline.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Stealing and manuplating sensitive data
damageScenario.consequence_DS: If senstive data is stolen then it will cause huge loss to indivial as well as organization
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: This could have a devastating impact on the organization, depending on the data that is stolen or the systems that are taken offline.

damageScenario.Damage Scenario: Flood a device or network with traffic
damageScenario.Reasoning for the relevance of the DS fo: Attacker can overwhelm the network and prevent legitimate messages from being sent
damageScenario.Reasoning for the choice of the conseque: This is a moderate impact threat making it unavailable to legitimate users this could disrupt operations or deny access to critical services.
damageScenario.damage_scenario: Flood a device or network with traffic
damageScenario.consequence_DS: Attacker can overwhelm the network and prevent legitimate messages from being sent
damageScenario.consequence_reasoning: This is a moderate impact threat making it unavailable to legitimate users this could disrupt operations or deny access to critical services.

SecGoals.Description: Unauthorized access to Amazon Redshift risks exposure of sensitive data, corruption of database integrity, and disruption of data availability, compromising core aspects of security.
SecGoals.objective_description: Unauthorized access to Amazon Redshift risks exposure of sensitive data, corruption of database integrity, and disruption of data availability, compromising core aspects of security.

SecGoals.Description:
Confidentiality: In AWS QuickSight, unauthorized access could lead to the exposure of sensitive information and data visualizations.
Integrity: Data manipulation or unauthorized alterations in AWS QuickSight can compromise the accuracy and reliability of business insights and reports.
Availability: Service disruptions or downtimes in AWS QuickSight can hinder access to critical business analytics and decision-making dashboards.
SecGoals.objective_description:
Confidentiality: In AWS QuickSight, unauthorized access could lead to the exposure of sensitive information and data visualizations.
Integrity: Data manipulation or unauthorized alterations in AWS QuickSight can compromise the accuracy and reliability of business insights and reports.
Availability: Service disruptions or downtimes in AWS QuickSight can hinder access to critical business analytics and decision-making dashboards.

SecGoals.Description:
Confidentiality: A breach in AWS Personalize could expose sensitive user data and personalization details to unauthorized parties.
Integrity: Data tampering in AWS Personalize can lead to skewed personalization algorithms, resulting in inaccurate or manipulative content recommendations.
Availability: Disruptions in AWS Personalize service may result in the unavailability of personalized user experiences.
SecGoals.objective_description:
Confidentiality: A breach in AWS Personalize could expose sensitive user data and personalization details to unauthorized parties.
Integrity: Data tampering in AWS Personalize can lead to skewed personalization algorithms, resulting in inaccurate or manipulative content recommendations.
Availability: Disruptions in AWS Personalize service may result in the unavailability of personalized user experiences.

SecGoals.Description: USB stack API should not expose sensitive information needed to access the system. USB stack API should not be tampered by MITM attacks to affect performance.
SecGoals.objective_description: USB stack API should not expose sensitive information needed to access the system. USB stack API should not be tampered by MITM attacks to affect performance.

SecGoals.Description: The data communication between the device and the WiFi network is confidential and must not be exposed.
SecGoals.objective_description: The data communication between the device and the WiFi network is confidential and must not be exposed.

SecGoals.Description: The data communication between WiFi and the device must not be manipulated.
SecGoals.objective_description: The data communication between WiFi and the device must not be manipulated.

SecGoals.Description: The WiFi Interface must be available to enable data communication between the network and device.
SecGoals.objective_description: The WiFi Interface must be available to enable data communication between the network and device.

SecGoals.Description: Strict access control should be implemented both physically to protect from unauthorized access.
SecGoals.objective_description: Strict access control should be implemented both physically to protect from unauthorized access.

SecGoals.Description: WiFi module should always be available to provide WiFi connectivity among devices.
SecGoals.objective_description: WiFi module should always be available to provide WiFi connectivity among devices.

SecGoals.Description: It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be exposed.
SecGoals.objective_description: It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be exposed.

SecGoals.Description: It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be tampered. Loss of integrity will impact the functionality of the system.
SecGoals.objective_description: It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be tampered. Loss of integrity will impact the functionality of the system.

SecGoals.Description: It is required that the WiFi access point is always up and made available to the user whenever required for configuration. Loss of availability will lead to Denial-of-service
SecGoals.objective_description: It is required that the WiFi access point is always up and made available to the user whenever required for configuration. Loss of availability will lead to Denial-of-service

SecGoals.Description: WiFi Router should be protected from denial of service attacks
SecGoals.objective_description: WiFi Router should be protected from denial of service attacks

SecGoals.Description: Unauthorized individuals may exploit the JTAG interface to extract sensitive information from the device, potentially compromising the confidentiality of critical system data. The JTAG interface could be used by attackers to manipulate firmware or hardware settings, leading to altered device behavior, system instability, or insertion of malicious code, thereby compromising the integrity of the device. Attackers might block or disrupt legitimate JTAG interface access, hindering essential maintenance, debugging, or updating processes, which could lead to system downtime.
SecGoals.objective_description: Unauthorized individuals may exploit the JTAG interface to extract sensitive information from the device, potentially compromising the confidentiality of critical system data. The JTAG interface could be used by attackers to manipulate firmware or hardware settings, leading to altered device behavior, system instability, or insertion of malicious code, thereby compromising the integrity of the device. Attackers might block or disrupt legitimate JTAG interface access, hindering essential maintenance, debugging, or updating processes, which could lead to system downtime.

SecGoals.objective_description: Availability - NFC communication shall be protected by DDoS attack to prevent blocking or loss of fuctionality.

Confidentiality: Safeguards data handled by the API against unauthorized exposure.
Integrity: Maintains the correctness of data processed by the API.
Availability: Ensures that the BLE API is consistently accessible and functional for authorized users and applications.

Confidentiality: Safeguards data handled by the API against unauthorized exposure.
Integrity: Maintains the correctness of data processed by the API.
Availability: Ensures that the BLE API is consistently accessible and functional for authorized users and applications.

Confidentiality: Protects any transmitted data from unauthorized access and eavesdropping.
Integrity: Ensures the accuracy and completeness of data during transmission.
Availability: Maintains reliable communication channels, free from disruptions.

SecurityNeeds.Security Need Description: Authentication and authorization mechanisms shall be implemented for Amazon Translate to safeguard translation data, ensuring protection against unauthorized access
Translation input and output data shall be encrypted at rest to protect from unauthorized manipulation of data
Amazon Translate shall implement logging and monitoring mechanims to record and monitor all the API calls or to detect any suspicious activities
There shall be proper access controls to secure kinesis video streams from unauthorized access
SecurityNeeds.Threat T: Extraction of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
SecurityNeeds.Threat: Extraction of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
SecurityNeeds.Threat_T: Extraction of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
SecurityNeeds.affected_security_goal: Confidentiality of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams

SecurityNeeds.Security Need Description: Kinesis Video Steams shall be encrypted at rest
SecurityNeeds.Threat T: Manipulation of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
SecurityNeeds.Threat: Manipulation of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
SecurityNeeds.Threat_T: Manipulation of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams
SecurityNeeds.affected_security_goal: Integrity of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams

SecurityNeeds.Security Need Description: Monitoring mechanism shall be implemented for Kinesis Videos Streams
SecurityNeeds.affected_security_goal: Availability of Amazon Kinesis Video Streams

SecurityNeeds.Security Need Description: Redshift clusters shall be encrypted at rest.
Connections to Amazon Redshift clusters shall be encrypted in transit.
Robust access control measures for Amazon Redshift clusters shall be implemented.
Amazon Redshift clusters shall have audit logging enabled.
Network security for Amazon Redshift clusters shall be enhanced.
Robust access control shall be implemented.
API and user activity logging shall be implemented
Data shall be encrypted at rest.
Data shall be encrypted at transit.
Regular backups of QuickSight dashboards and datasets shall be ensured.
Comprehensive monitoring mechanisms shall be implemented.
Robust access control shall be implemented.
Continuous monitoring and logging of access and activities within the environment shall be implemented.
Proper validation of data sources and inputs shall be implemented
Rate limiting mechanisms shall be implemented
Robust backup systems and data redundancy measures shall be established
USB stack shall implement robust access control mechanisms to ensure that only authorized devices and users can initiate USB connections and data transfers.
USB stack shall employ strong encryption techniques to protect data integrity and confidentiality during USB data transfers.
USB stack shall ensure the integrity and security of USB drivers and firmware.
USB stack shall facilitate continuous monitoring and logging of all USB activities.
Network Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS) shall be deployed at the network perimeter to detect known attacks in the network traffic.
Communication between the WiFi interface and its device employ two-way authentication mechanism to prevent spoofing on WiFi.
Employ advanced anomaly detection mechanisms to identify abnormal traffic patterns indicative of a potential DoS attack
Firmware shall be protected against manipulation
Communication through WiFi/LAN shall employ industry standard and strong encryption suites to prevent crypt-analysis attacks
WiFi Access Point or Ethernet LAN Switch/Router shall be protected against known WiFi and Ethernet LAN attacks
The system shall protect the WiFi access point from Denial-of-service attack
Configure firewalls to filter incoming and outgoing traffic. Create rules that block or limit traffic from known malicious sources
Real-time monitoring tools to detect and respond to unusual spikes in Wi-Fi module activity
WPA3 or WPA2 encryption protocol are enabled to secure the network
JTAG interface shall be disabled during EOL process if not required in field.
JTAG configuration data shall be stored in memory locations which are protected against unauthorized read and write accesses.
If JTAG interface is not required it shall be removed
Runtime manipulation of the JATG configuration data shall also be protected.
If JTAG interface is required it shall be protected using authentication mechanism
JTAG port shall be closed if not used
JTAG port shall be disabled or protected from physical access
JTAG data transmissions shall be encrypted
NFC Tags shall implement cryptographic mechanisms, including secure authentication to prevent unauthorized extraction
NFC tags shall employ integrity checks to detect and prevent manipulation attempts
NFC Readers shall implement secure authentication mechanisms and physical controls to prevent unauthorized access and extraction
NFC communication shall employ cryptographic mechanisms, such as digital signatures,encryption protocol to detect and prevent unauthorized manipulation
Sensitive information like UID in NFC Card shall be protected against reading out using encryption mechanims

The NFC Card shall be safeguarded through the implementation of security measures, including tamper-evident and tamper-resistant features, to enhance protection against unauthorized access or tampering or blocking
BLE communication shall be encrypted
BLE API shall implement rate limiting.
User authentication shall be built into the BLE application to enable service level authentication
BLE communication shall be protected against DoS attacks
BLE communication shall check for authenticity
BLE communication shall have integrity check
BLE communication shall use mutual authentication
BLE shall employ cryptographic checksums or digital signature to verify data integrity.
BLE API shall perform input validation
BLE shall implement secure paring mechanisms.
BLE API shall restrict access to sensitive functions and data.
Link keys shall be unique and random and not static and shall not be reused for every pairing.
BLE API shall encrypt sensitive data which it handles.
Authentication of CAN messages shall be implemented to avoid spoofing attacks.

Message authentication shall be used to ensure the authenticity and integrity of messages in CAN channel.This is required at least for the communication channels between CSS gateway and untrusted zone
Configuration file shall be protected against unauthorized manipulation
Configuration data shall be encrypted to prevent unauthorized users from reading it. This can be done using encryption algorithms, such as AES or DES.
SecurityNeeds.Threat T: Manipulation of Configuration data for CAN Channels
SecurityNeeds.Threat: Manipulation of Configuration data for CAN Channels
SecurityNeeds.Threat_T: Manipulation of Configuration data for CAN Channels
SecurityNeeds.affected_security_goal: Integrity of Configuration data for CAN Channels

SecurityNeeds.Security Need Description: Freshness value shall be implenmented for CAN message. Stale data shall be discarded
Secure messaging protocol, such as TLS or Ipsec shall be implemented
Authenticating FlexRay messages can help to prevent spoofing
Filtering messages can help to prevent DoS attacks.
Encryption shall be implemented to protect data from eavesdropping.
Implement strict access controls to limit who can access and manipulate the serial port.
Implement redundancy in critical systems, such as redundant serial ports or backup communication channels, to maintain communication in case of a blockage.

assetaddition.Description:
Confidentiality: In AWS QuickSight, unauthorized access could lead to the exposure of sensitive information and data visualizations.
Integrity: Data manipulation or unauthorized alterations in AWS QuickSight can compromise the accuracy and reliability of business insights and reports.
Availability: Service disruptions or downtimes in AWS QuickSight can hinder access to critical business analytics and decision-making dashboards.

assetaddition.Description:
Confidentiality: A breach in AWS Personalize could expose sensitive user data and personalization details to unauthorized parties.
Integrity: Data tampering in AWS Personalize can lead to skewed personalization algorithms, resulting in inaccurate or manipulative content recommendations.
Availability: Disruptions in AWS Personalize service may result in the unavailability of personalized user experiences.

assetaddition.objective_description: The data communication between WiFi and the device must not be manipulated.

assetaddition.Description: The WiFi Interface must be available to enable data communication between the network and device.

assetaddition.objective_description: Strict access control should be implemented both physically to protect from unauthorized access.

assetaddition.Description: WiFi module should always be available to provide WiFi connectivity among devices.

assetaddition.Description: It is required that the configuration information sent from the user to the access point must not be tampered. Loss of integrity will impact the functionality of the system.

assetaddition.Description: WiFi Router should be protected from denial of service attacks
assetaddition.objective_description: WiFi Router should be protected from denial of service attacks

assetaddition.Description: Unauthorized individuals may exploit the JTAG interface to extract sensitive information from the device, potentially compromising the confidentiality of critical system data. The JTAG interface could be used by attackers to manipulate firmware or hardware settings, leading to altered device behavior, system instability, or insertion of malicious code, thereby compromising the integrity of the device. Attackers might block or disrupt legitimate JTAG interface access, hindering essential maintenance, debugging, or updating processes, which could lead to system downtime.
assetaddition.objective_description: Unauthorized individuals may exploit the JTAG interface to extract sensitive information from the device, potentially compromising the confidentiality of critical system data. The JTAG interface could be used by attackers to manipulate firmware or hardware settings, leading to altered device behavior, system instability, or insertion of malicious code, thereby compromising the integrity of the device. Attackers might block or disrupt legitimate JTAG interface access, hindering essential maintenance, debugging, or updating processes, which could lead to system downtime.
